name: test_deep_thought
content: How can I monitor my nvidia GPU performance on Windows 10 using powershell?

name: test_deep_thought
content:
{
    "answer": "You can monitor your NVIDIA GPU performance on Windows 10 using
PowerShell by utilizing the NVIDIA Management Library (NVML) and the Get-NvGpu
cmdlet. First, ensure you have the NVIDIA drivers installed and the NVML library
is available. Then, use the following command to retrieve information about your
GPU: Get-NvGpu | Select-Object -ExpandProperty GpuInfo. This will provide
details such as GPU name, memory usage, temperature, and more.",
    "sources": "https://developer.nvidia.com/nvidia-management-library-nvml"
}

name: test_deep_thought
content: Is there an easier way if I have cuda installed?

name: test_deep_thought
content:
{
    "answer": "If you have CUDA installed, you can use the nvidia-smi command-
line tool to monitor your NVIDIA GPU performance. This tool provides detailed
information about your GPU, including memory usage, temperature, and more.
Simply open a command prompt or PowerShell window and type 'nvidia-smi' to view
the current state of your GPU.",
    "sources": "https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-zone"
}
